result.execSummary:
The defendant Fontaine D Dillard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 3:11pm [ma]
Defendant Fontaine D Dillard in court, in custody with attorney David Westrick.  Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Mr Dillard indiactes he is currently located at Racine Correctional Institute

Mr.Dillard waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

recess: 3:13pm--reconvene: 3:19pm 

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived

Constitutional rights reviewed; maximum penalties recited; plea of " GUILTY  " entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Mr. Dillard   guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
Statement made by Mr. Dillard

The Court sentences Mr. Dillard   to  5  years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  2  years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 3  years.  This sentence is concurrent to sentence in being, Dane Co. Case  2012CF2089

The Court finds that the Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that the Defendant is NOT eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
 
The Court gives  0   days credit for time already served.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with treatment recommendations
--to undergo assessment, treatment or  counseling as required by the Agent
--attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program per Agent
--no contact with Herb or Sandy Blasing or Herbie's Bar
--to pay statutory costs
--to pay restitution to Herbie's Bar c/o Herb and Sandy Blasing in the amount of $250

The Court finds that Mr. Dillard has previously provided a DNA sample
Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
recess: 3:52pm

to Produce the Defendant for the 11/15/16 Hearing

Due to inability to gain connection on time with Racine Correctional Facility, Mr. Dillard was already removed from the videoconferencing room.
Atty. Westrick informs the Court and ADA Shock that Defense is requesting the case be scheduled for plea and sentencing. 
With no objection for ADA Shock, the Court directs that this case be scheduled for plea and sentencing, the waiver of prelim. will be conducted at that time; the State is to prepare a writ for Mr. Dillard's appearace at the to be scheduled date.
